methods.comments:
Optional[/**
 * Manages the movement of JInternalFrame inside the area of
 * JDesktopPane, preventing the frames from being moved out of the visible area.
 *
 * @param component JComponent - the component of which
 *                  to manage the move.
 * @param x - x coordinate of the point where the component was moved
 * @param y - y coordinate of the point where the component was moved
 */
]

Optional[/**
 * Customize the action of reducing the JInternalFrame to an icon.
 *
 * @param frame JInternalFrame - a frame inside a JDesktopPane.
 */
]
methods.generated_comment:
/**
 * Iconifies the specified internal frame by setting its size to 200x30, disabling certain features, 
 * and adding it to the list of iconified frames. The method calculates the position of the iconified frame 
 * based on the desktop pane size and the existing iconified frames.
 * 
 * @param frame the internal frame to be iconified
 */

methods.comments:
Optional[/**
 * Restore the frame from being minimized, resetting the
 * position and size it had before.
 *
 * @param frame JInternalFrame - a frame inside a JDesktopPane.
 */
]

Optional[/**
 * Return the focus to a selected frame, and, if the frame
 * is iconified, it deiconifies it.
 *
 * @param frame JInternalFrame - a frame within a JDesktopPane
 */
]

Optional[/**
 * Center the frame supplied as a parameter in JDesktopPane.
 *
 * @param frame JInternalFrame - a frame inside a JDesktopPane.
 */
]
methods.generated_comment:
/**
 * Centers the specified internal frame on its parent desktop pane.
 * 
 * @param frame the internal frame to be centered
 * @return void
 * 
 * This method calculates the center coordinates of the parent desktop pane
 * and positions the specified internal frame at the center of the desktop pane.
 * The internal frame will be centered both horizontally and vertically.
 */

methods.comments:
Optional[/**
 * Redraw the frames in the desktop that are iconified.
 *
 * @param desk JDesktopPane - a desktop pane associated with a
 *              DeskManager.
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied parameter is not
 *                                    associated with a DeskManager.
 */
]

Optional[/**
 * Redraw (and resize if necessary) all the frames contained in a
 * given JDesktopPane.
 *
 * @param desk JDesktopPane - a desktop pane.
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied desktop pane is not
 *                                    associated with a DeskManager.
 */
]

Optional[/**
 * Open a frame of the specified class using the display.
 * If a frame of the given class already exists, it activates that frame.
 *
 * @param clazz Class - a class type that extends JInternalFrame.
 * @param desk JDesktopPane - a desktop pane.
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException - if the provided class does not extend JInternalFrame.
 */
]
methods.generated_comment:
/**
 * Opens a new internal frame of the specified class on the given desktop pane.
 * If the provided class does not extend javax.swing.JInternalFrame, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
 * If a frame of the same class is already open on the desktop pane, that frame is activated.
 * If no frame of the same class is found, a new instance of the class is created and added to the desktop pane.
 * The new frame is positioned on the desktop pane according to a predefined algorithm to prevent overlapping.
 * 
 * @param clazz the class of the internal frame to open
 * @param desk the desktop pane on which to open the internal frame
 */
public void openFrame(Class<?> clazz, JDesktopPane desk) {
    // method body as described above
}
**/

methods.comments:
Optional[/**
 * Displays a popup menu with options for frames of a desktop pane
 * at the selected location.
 *
 * @param point Point - the point where to place the menu.
 * @param desk JDesktopPane - a JDesktopPane that is associated with a DeskManager.
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied parameter is not associated with a DeskManager.
 */
]
methods.generated_comment:
/**
 * Displays a popup menu on the provided JDesktopPane at the specified location.
 * 
 * @param point the Point object representing the location where the popup menu should be displayed
 * @param desk the JDesktopPane on which the popup menu should be displayed
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the provided JDesktopPane does not have a DesktopManager associated with it
 * 
 * This method enables and disables menu items based on the number of internal frames and iconified frames on the JDesktopPane.
 * If there are no internal frames, all menu items are disabled. If all frames are iconified, the "Restore All" menu item is disabled.
 * The popup menu is displayed at the specified location on the JDesktopPane.
 */

methods.comments:
Optional[/**
 * Deiconifies all frames previously iconified.
 */
]
methods.generated_comment:
/**
 * Deiconifies all iconified internal frames in the container.
 * 
 * This method iterates through the list of iconified frames and sets each frame to be visible.
 * If any frame encounters a PropertyVetoException while trying to deiconify, it will be caught and printed to the console.
 * 
 * @param None
 * @return None
 */

methods.comments:
Optional[/**
 * Minimize all frames of a provided JDesktopPane that is associated with a DeskManager.
 *
 * @param desk JDesktopPane - a desktop pane.
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied parameter is not associated with a DeskManager.
 */
]

Optional[/**
 * Close all frames in a given JDesktopPane.
 *
 * @param desk JDesktopPane - a desktop pane associated with a DeskManager.
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied parameter is not associated with a DeskManager.
 */
]

methods.generated_comment:
/**
 * Initializes the desktop menu with options to collapse all, reset all, and close all internal frames.
 * The method creates a JPopupMenu and adds JMenuItem options for collapsing, resetting, and closing all internal frames.
 * Each JMenuItem is associated with an ActionListener that performs the corresponding action when clicked.
 * 
 * @param None
 * @return None
 */

/**
 * This method handles the actionPerformed event for the specified ActionEvent.
 * It checks the source of the event and performs different actions based on it.
 * If the event source is ripristinaTutti, it deiconifies all internal frames.
 * If the event source is closeAll, it closes all internal frames within the specified JDesktopPane.
 * If the event source is riduciTutti, it iconifies all internal frames within the specified JDesktopPane.
 * 
 * @param aEvent the ActionEvent to be handled
 * @return void
 */

constructors.generated_comment:
/**
 * Constructs a new DeskManager object.
 * 
 * This constructor initializes a new DeskManager object with default values. It initializes an empty Vector to store iconified frames,
 * initializes the desk menu, and sets the initial location of the DeskManager to (0, -1).
 * 
 * Parameters:
 * None
 * 
 * Behavior:
 * - Initializes an empty Vector to store iconified frames
 * - Initializes the desk menu
 * - Sets the initial location of the DeskManager to (0, -1)
 */

generated_class_comment:
/**
 * The DeskManager class provides functionality for managing JInternalFrames within a JDesktopPane.
 * It includes methods for dragging frames, iconifying frames, deiconifying frames, activating frames,
 * centering frames, repainting iconified frames, opening frames of a specified class, showing a popup menu,
 * deiconifying all frames, closing all frames, and initializing the desk menu.
 * 
 * The class also contains variables for storing iconified frames, desk menu components, and location coordinates.
 * 
 * DeskManager Class:
 * - Manages the movement of JInternalFrames within a JDesktopPane to prevent frames from going out of bounds.
 * - Customizes the action of reducing a JInternalFrame to an icon and restoring it to its original state.
 * - Activates a selected frame and brings it to the front, deiconifying it if necessary.
 * - Centers a frame within its parent container.
 * - Repaints iconified frames on the desktop pane according to a specific layout.
 * - Repaints all visible frames within a JDesktopPane to ensure they fit within the desktop's bounds.
 * - Opens a new internal frame of a specified class on a JDesktopPane, activating it if already open.
 * - Displays a popup menu with options for frames at a selected location on a JDesktopPane.
 * - Deiconifies all iconified frames within the container.
 * - Closes all internal frames within a JDesktopPane.
 * - Initializes the desktop menu with options to collapse all, reset all, and close all internal frames.
 * 
 * Variables:
 * - URL_IMAGES: a constant string representing the URL for images used in the class.
 * - deskMenu: a JPopupMenu for displaying options for managing frames.
 * - riduciTutti: a JMenuItem for collapsing all frames.
 * - ripristinaTutti: a JMenuItem for resetting all frames.
 * - closeAll: a JMenuItem for closing all frames.
 * - iconifiedFrames: a Vector to store iconified frames.
 * - locationX: an integer representing the x-coordinate for frame positioning.
 * - locationY: an integer representing the y-coordinate for frame positioning.
 * 
 * Default Constructor:
 * - Initializes a new DeskManager object with default values.
 * - Initializes an empty Vector to store iconified frames.
 * - Initializes the desk menu and sets the initial location of the DeskManager.
 * 
 * @see JInternalFrame
 * @see JDesktopPane
 * @see JComponent
 * @see JPopupMenu
 * @see JMenuItem
 */
